title: Lanka records best-ever tourism year as arrivals surpass 2.36mn in 2025 - Gold FM News - Srilanka's Number One News Portal, Most visited website in Sri Lanka
text:
Tourist arrivals in December exceeded the 260,000 mark, marking a strong rebound following the adverse impact of the Dikwella floods. Total tourist arrivals also surpassed 2.36 million, making 2025 Sri Lanka’s best-performing year for tourism.
Average daily arrivals increased to a healthy level of over 10,000 visitors, reflecting sustained momentum during the peak travel period.
Sri Lanka proudly welcomed its 2,333,797th tourist on 27 December, officially surpassing the previous all-time record of 2,333,796 arrivals recorded in 2018 and confirming 2025 as the country’s golden year for tourism.
Prof. Felix Beslin Pereira from India became the milestone tourist, arriving on SriLankan Airlines flight UL 165 from Trivandrum.
From January 2025 to 29 December, seven source markets recorded more than 100,000 arrivals each. India led the list with 528,482 arrivals, followed by the United Kingdom (211,047), the Russian Federation (184,050), Germany (146,802), China (131,556), Australia (108,628) and France (108,596).
